title: Love Island's Eoghan Murphy second thoughts on Jessie Wynter in new preview
text:
He's the Irish intruder who coupled up with Jessie Wynter on Tuesday night's episode of Love Island Australia.

But Eoghan Murphy, 24, has hinted he may be regretting his decision, in a new promo for Wednesday night's episode.

The preview shows the new couple getting into bed together for the first time, with 23-year-old Jessie saying how excited she is.

'Have I made the right decision?' Love Island's Eoghan Murphy (left) appears to have second thoughts about coupling up with Jessie Wynter (right) in a new preview on Wednesday

'It feels good, I'm happy I chose you. Choosing you is a statement of intent and it's like, you're the person I want to get to know,' Eoghan explained to Jessie.

Jessie simply replied: 'I'm really happy about your intent.'

'Have I made the right decision?' the bearded hunk said in a private interview before taking a deep breath, suggesting he wasn't quite sure.

Doubts: The bearded hunk mulled over his decision in a private interview before taking a deep breath, suggesting he wasn't quite sure

Feeling it: The preview shows the new couple getting into bed together for the first time, with Jessie saying how excited she is

Earlier in the clip, 19-year-old Cartier Surjan reacted to the Irish hunk picking Jessie over her.

'When he said Jessie I was like 'Yay!' and then I was like 'Um, uh, yay me'', the brunette lifeguard sarcastically said.

During Tuesday night's episode, Eoghan had told Cartier that he was 'leaning towards her' but despite this, ended up picking Jessie.

Salty? 'When he said Jessie I was like 'Yay!' and then I was like 'Um, uh, yay me'' Cartier Surjan sarcastically said, reacting to Eoghan picking Jessie over her

Vulnerable: Eoghan's new coupling with Jessie means that Maurice Salib (pictured) is now without a partner and must find a new one in order to avoid being 'dumped' from the Island.

Eoghan's new coupling with Jessie means that Maurice Salib is now without a partner and must find a new one in order to avoid being 'dumped' from the Island.

Just as the Irishman's presence stirred things up, the addition of two female intruders Anna and Phoebe will also ruffle feathers in the next episode.

Love Island Australia continues Wednesday at 8:40pm on Channel Nine
description: He's the Irish intruder who coupled up with Jessie Wynter on Tuesday night's episode of Love Island Australia.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
